ground_truth: A long drawn wail comes down the wind, like the cry of some evil and lonely creature. Sam grabs Merry and Pippin as the Hobbits quickly scramble down the bank, hiding under a mossy log. The sound of hooves is close. A sinister mounted Ringwraith steps into view, hooded and faceless, mounted on a huge snarling black horse with insane eyes. Frodo freezes in terror. The Ringwraith pauses right beside their hiding place, sitting very still with his head bowed, listening. Beads of sweat gather on his brow. The Ringwraith suddenly slides off his horse, leaning over the mossy log and peering suspiciously into the woods. From inside the hood comes a sniffing noise as if he is trying to catch an elusive scent, his head turning from side to side. He is drawing the ring out of his pocket, with trembling hands, his face fevered and sweating as if in the grip of some terrible internal struggle. Merry desperately hurls the mushrooms across the road. The Ringwraith spins around at the sound and darts to the far side of the road with frightening speed. Frodo instantly slumps as if a psychic link had been broken. Frodo is staring, a look of shock on his face at the ring lying in the palm of his hand. The Black Rider turns and departs. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin hurry through the trees, slipping and sliding on the muddy ground. Merry moves past Pippin toward Frodo, watching intently, while Sam keeps looking around nervously. The four Hobbits sprawl on the ground, holding their breath. The silhouette of a Black Rider looms against the skyline. Merry looks at his friend, realizing Frodo is in deep trouble. The Hobbits break cover. Suddenly, a Ringwraith bursts out of the forest toward them. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin are running toward the wide, placid Brandywine River and the ferry. The Hobbits stampede across the wharf and tumble onto the ferry. Frodo races across the wooden wharf, followed by the Ringwraiths. He leaps into the ferry, shrieking with rage. The Hobbits cover their ears. Sam and Merry shove off with the poles. The ferry slides out into the river, just as the Ringwraiths arrive. The Ringwraiths wheel their horses toward the north and gallop away along the riverbank, quickly disappearing into the fog. Lights of Bree, a small village of stone and half-timbered houses, are nestled against a low wooded hill. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin approach the gatehouse, wild-eyed, ragged, and out of breath. A thick hedge surrounds the village, and a great gate bars the western entrance. A surly gatekeeper glances down at them. The gatekeeper swings his lantern onto the Hobbits, bathing them in an uncomfortable yellow spotlight. The Hobbits gratefully enter Bree, the gatekeeper eyeing them curiously in the lantern light.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A lengthy protracted lament echoes down the breeze, like the scream of some wicked and isolated being. Sam seizes Merry and Pippin as the Hobbits swiftly clamber down the embankment, concealing beneath a mossy timber. The noise of hooves is nearby. A menacing mounted Ringwraith strides into sight, hooded and faceless, astride a massive snarling ebony steed with deranged eyes. Frodo stiffens in dread. The Ringwraith halts right next to their concealment, sitting extremely motionless with his head inclined, heeding. Droplets of perspiration form on his forehead. The Ringwraith abruptly glides off his horse, leaning over the mossy timber and scrutinizing warily into the woodland. From within the hood emanates a sniffing sound as if he is attempting to capture an elusive aroma, his head swiveling from side to side. He is extracting the band out of his pocket, with quivering hands, his visage fevered and sweating as if in the clutches of some dreadful internal battle. Merry frantically tosses the fungi across the road. The Ringwraith whirls around at the noise and dashes to the far edge of the road with terrifying swiftness. Frodo instantaneously slumps as if a mental connection had been severed. Frodo is gazing, an expression of astonishment on his countenance at the band resting in the palm of his hand. The Black Rider turns and leaves. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin hasten through the woods, slipping and sliding on the soggy terrain. Merry advances past Pippin toward Frodo, observing intently, while Sam keeps glancing around anxiously. The four Hobbits sprawl on the ground, holding their breath. The outline of a Black Rider towers against the horizon. Merry looks at his companion, realizing Frodo is in dire peril. The Hobbits emerge. Suddenly, a Ringwraith erupts out of the forest toward them. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin are rushing toward the broad, calm Brandywine River and the ferry. The Hobbits charge across the pier and tumble onto the ferry. Frodo dashes across the wooden pier, pursued by the Ringwraiths. He vaults into the ferry, shrieking with fury. The Hobbits cover their ears. Sam and Merry shove off with the poles. The ferry glides out into the river, just as the Ringwraiths arrive. The Ringwraiths wheel their steeds toward the north and gallop away along the riverbank, swiftly vanishing into the haze. Lights of Bree, a small hamlet of stone and half-timbered dwellings, are nestled against a low wooded slope. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin approach the gatehouse, wild-eyed, ragged, and out of breath. A dense hedge encircles the hamlet, and a great gate bars the western entrance. A surly gatekeeper glances down at them. The gatekeeper swings his lantern onto the Hobbits, enveloping them in an uncomfortable yellow glow. The Hobbits gratefully enter Bree, the gatekeeper observing them curiously in the lantern light.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A long, drawn-out wail travels down the wind, echoing eerily like the mournful cry of some sinister and lonely creature lurking in the shadows. Sam quickly grasps Merry and Pippin, pulling them close as the Hobbits swiftly scramble down the bank, seeking refuge underneath the protective cover of a mossy log. The ominous sound of hooves grows nearer, the atmosphere thick with tension. A malevolent, hooded Ringwraith appears ominously in view, sitting atop a massive, snarling black horse with eyes that seem to radiate madness. Frodo is paralyzed with terror, unable to move. The Ringwraith halts right beside their hiding place, sitting motionless with his head bowed, as if listening intently for any hint of movement. Beads of sweat form on his brow, glistening in the strain of the moment. The Ringwraith dismounts suddenly, leaning over the moss-covered log, peering suspiciously into the dense woods. From within the depths of his hood comes a sniffing noise, as if he is trying to catch an elusive scent, his head swiveling from side to side. Frodo's trembling hand inches toward the ring in his pocket, his face feverish, covered in sweat, as if caught in the grip of a terrible internal battle. In a moment of desperation, Merry hurls the mushrooms across the road, causing the Ringwraith to spin around at the unexpected sound, darting to the far side of the road with a terrifying speed. Frodo collapses instantly, as if a psychic link had been broken, staring in shock at the ring lying in the palm of his hand. The Black Rider turns and silently departs. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin hasten through the trees, slipping and sliding on the muddied ground, trying to distance themselves from the danger. Merry moves past Pippin, advancing anxiously toward Frodo, while Sam keeps nervously glancing around. The four Hobbits sprawl on the ground, holding their breath in suspense. The silhouette of a Black Rider looms menacingly against the skyline. Merry looks at his friend, realizing Frodo is in deep and profound trouble. The Hobbits break cover, suddenly emerging from their hiding place. Abruptly, a Ringwraith bursts out of the forest, charging toward them. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin dash headlong toward the broad, placid Brandywine River and the safety of the ferry. The Hobbits stampede across the wharf, tumbling onto the ferry in their haste. Frodo races across the wooden planks of the wharf, with the relentless Ringwraiths in pursuit. He leaps onto the ferry, filled with a mix of terror and rage. The Hobbits cover their ears, overwhelmed by the intensity of the moment. Sam and Merry push off frantically with the poles, the ferry gliding slowly out into the middle of the river just as the Ringwraiths arrive at the edge. The Ringwraiths wheel their imposing horses toward the north, galloping away along the riverbank, quickly vanishing into the dense, enveloping fog. The lights of Bree, a quaint village composed of stone and half-timbered houses, are nestled comfortably against a low, wooded hill. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin approach the village gatehouse, wild-eyed, ragged, and gasping for breath. A thick hedge encircles the village, and a formidable gate bars the western entrance. A surly gatekeeper peers down at them, scrutinizing their appearance. He swings his lantern toward the Hobbits, bathing them in an uncomfortable, flickering yellow light. The Hobbits gratefully enter the village of Bree, the gatekeeper eyeing them with curiosity in the lantern's glow.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A long, drawn-out wail echoes down the wind, eerily resembling the cry of some evil and lonely creature. As this unsettling sound reaches their ears, Sam quickly grabs Merry and Pippin, his hands moving with urgency as the Hobbits make a swift decision to scramble down the bank. They hastily find refuge under a mossy log, their bodies pressing close to the damp earth to conceal themselves. Meanwhile, the rhythmic pounding of hooves grows ominously close. Into their line of sight steps a sinister mounted Ringwraith, its figure hooded and faceless, perched atop a huge snarling black horse whose eyes seem to radiate madness. Frodo, in response, is immobilized by a wave of terror, his body freezing in place. The Ringwraith, seated with an unsettling stillness, halts just beside their hiding spot. With its head bowed, it remains motionless, its sinister presence keenly listening. Beads of cold sweat begin to form and gather on Frodo's brow, betraying his anxiety. Suddenly, the Ringwraith dismounts with a smooth, albeit eerie motion, leaning over the mossy log with a suspicious gaze that delves into the woods. From the depths of the hood, a sniffing sound emerges, as if the creature is attempting to catch an elusive scent, its head moving slowly from side to side. Frodo's hand, trembling and drenched in sweat, reaches for the ring in his pocket, his face contorted in a feverish struggle as if battling a terrifying internal conflict. In a desperate move, Merry seizes a handful of mushrooms and hurls them across the road. The Ringwraith reacts instantaneously to the noise, spinning around with predatory swiftness and darting to the far side of the road. At that moment, a psychic connection seems to sever, causing Frodo to slump in sudden relief, his breath escaping in a rush. He casts his gaze downward, his eyes wide with shock as he beholds the ring resting in the palm of his hand. As the Black Rider turns to depart, Frodo, along with Sam, Merry, and Pippin, scramble through the trees, their feet slipping and sliding on the muddy terrain. Merry maneuvers past Pippin to position himself near Frodo, his watchful eyes filled with concern, while Sam continues to glance around nervously as though expecting danger at every turn. The four Hobbits find themselves sprawled on the ground, their breaths held as the silhouette of another Black Rider looms menacingly against the skyline. Merry looks intently at Frodo, the realization dawning that his friend is in deep trouble. Breaking their fragile cover, the Hobbits suddenly find themselves pursued, a Ringwraith bursting forth from the forest in their direction. With renewed urgency, Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin sprint toward the wide and tranquil Brandywine River, their destination the safety of the ferry. The Hobbits stampede across the wooden planks of the wharf, their momentum carrying them forward until they tumble onto the ferry. Frodo races with all his might across the wooden wharf, the Ringwraiths giving chase, their presence a terrifying force at his heels. With a desperate leap, he lands onto the ferry, his voice rising in a shriek of fear and rage. Instinctively, the Hobbits raise their hands to cover their ears, the sound reverberating painfully. Sam and Merry work quickly with the poles, shoving off from the shore with all their strength as the ferry begins to glide out into the safety of the river. Just in time, as the Ringwraiths reach the riverbank, their frustration evident, they wheel their horses around toward the north, galloping away along the riverbank and disappearing rapidly into the thickening fog. In the distance, the welcoming lights of Bree appear, a small village composed of stone and half-timbered houses, nestled comfortably against a low wooded hill. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin, wild-eyed and looking ragged from their ordeal, approach the gatehouse, gasping for breath. A thick hedge encloses the village, with a great gate imposing itself upon the western entrance. From his post, a surly gatekeeper gives the Hobbits a cursory glance, the beam of his lantern sweeping over them, bathing them in an uncomfortable yellow light. Despite this, the Hobbits muster what relief they can and gratefully pass into Bree, the gatekeeper's curious eyes following them in the dim lantern light.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A haunting wail echoes through the air as Sam quickly pulls Merry and Pippin down a bank to hide under a mossy log. A menacing Ringwraith on a sinister black horse approaches, prompting Frodo to freeze in terror as it pauses beside their hiding place, sniffing for their presence. Struggling with internal conflict, Frodo is on the verge of drawing the ring from his pocket when Merry distracts the Ringwraith by throwing mushrooms across the road. The creature darts away, breaking its psychic hold over Frodo, who realizes with shock that the ring is in his hand. The Black Rider departs, and the Hobbits hurry through the muddy woods. As Merry notices Frodo’s distress, a silhouette of a Black Rider looms, and they break cover, fleeing toward the Brandywine River and the ferry. The Hobbits rush across the wharf and onto the ferry, just ahead of the Ringwraiths. Shoving off with poles, they escape into the river while the Ringwraiths turn north, disappearing into the fog along the riverbank. Exhausted and disheveled, Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin reach the gatehouse of Bree, a village nestled against a wooded hill. The surly gatekeeper shines his lantern on them, and they enter Bree, grateful, though still under the gatekeeper's curious gaze.

test_cases.description: A long drawn wail comes down the wind like the cry of some evil and lonely creature. Sam grabs Merry and Pippin as the Hobbits quickly scramble down the bank hiding under a mossy log. The sound of hooves is close. A sinister mounted Ringwraith steps into view hooded and faceless mounted on a huge snarling black horse with insane eyes. Frodo freezes in terror. The Ringwraith pauses right beside their hiding place sitting very still with his head bowed listening. Beads of sweat gather on his brow. The Ringwraith suddenly slides off his horse leaning over the mossy log and peering suspiciously into the woods. From inside the hood comes a sniffing noise as if he is trying to catch an elusive scent his head turning from side to side. He is drawing the ring out of his pocket with trembling hands his face fevered and sweating as if in the grip of some terrible internal struggle. Merry desperately hurls the mushrooms across the road. The Ringwraith spins around at the sound and darts to the far side of the road with frightening speed. Frodo instantly slumps as if a psychic link had been broken. Frodo is staring a look of shock on his face at the ring lying in the palm of his hand. The Black Rider turns and departs. Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin hurry through the trees slipping and sliding on the muddy ground. Merry moves past Pippin toward Frodo watching intently while Sam keeps looking around nervously. The four Hobbits sprawl on the ground holding their breath. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. The silhouette of a Black Rider looms against the skyline. Merry looks at his friend realizing Frodo is in deep trouble. The Hobbits break cover. Suddenly a Ringwraith bursts out of the forest toward them. Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin are running toward the wide placid Brandywine River and the ferry. The Hobbits stampede across the wharf and tumble onto the ferry. Frodo races across the wooden wharf followed by the Ringwraiths. He leaps into the ferry shrieking with rage. The Hobbits cover their ears. Sam and Merry shove off with the poles. The ferry slides out into the river just as the Ringwraiths arrive. The Ringwraiths wheel their horses toward the north and gallop away along the riverbank quickly disappearing into the fog. Lights of Bree. a small village of stone and halftimbered houses are nestled against a low wooded hill. Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin approach the gatehouse wildeyed ragged and out of breath. A thick hedge surrounds the village and a great gate bars the western entrance A surly gatekeeper glances down at them. The gatekeeper swings his lantern onto the Hobbits bathing them in an uncomfortable yellow spotlight. The Hobbits gratefully enter Bree the gatekeeper eyeing them curiously in the lantern light.

The four Hobbits crouch on the ground, holding their breath. The silhouette of a Black Rider hovers against the skyline. Merry glances at his friend, realizing Frodo is in deep trouble. The Hobbits burst from cover. Suddenly, a Ringwraith springs out of the forest toward them. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin are darting toward the wide, tranquil Brandywine River and the ferry. The Hobbits sprint across the wharf and stumble onto the ferry. Frodo dashes across the wooden wharf, pursued by the Ringwraiths. He jumps into the ferry, cackling with rage. The Hobbits cover their ears. Sam and Merry push off with the poles. The ferry drifts out into the river, just as the Ringwraiths arrive. The Ringwraiths turn their horses toward the north and trot away along the riverbank, quickly vanishing into the fog. Lights of Bree, a small village of stone and half-timbered houses, are tucked against a low wooded hill. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin approach the gatehouse, wild-eyed, ragged, and out of breath. A thick hedge encircles the village, and a great gate blocks the western entrance. A surly gatekeeper peers down at them. The gatekeeper swings his lantern onto the Hobbits, drenching them in an uncomfortable yellow spotlight. The Hobbits gratefully step into Bree, the gatekeeper observing them curiously in the lantern light.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A loud short bark echoes on the breeze, like the sound of some cheerful and social creature. Tom nudges Jerry and Spike as the Giants slowly shuffle up the tree, sitting above a mossy rock. The sound of wings is distant. A cheerful flapping Grifon soars into view, cloaked and wingless, perched on a small chirping white bird with gentle eyes. Sarah blinks in fascination. The Grifon charges far away from their sitting spot, leaning very far with its head raised, watching. Drops of mist form on its neck. The Grifon unexpectedly flutters to its perch, looking under the mossy rock and peeking joyfully at the sky. From within the cloak comes a chirping sound as if it is trying to find a friendly tune, its eyes blinking rapidly. It is pulling the feather into its beak, with steady wings, its expression calm and serene as if in the grip of some wonderful external excitement. Spike excitedly tosses the berries across the field. The Grifon spins around at the sight and glides to the near side of the field with graceful elegance. Sarah suddenly jumps as if a musical connection had been restored. Sarah is laughing, a grin of joy on her face at the feather resting on her cheek. The White Bird turns and waits. Sarah, Tom, Jerry, and Spike wander through the field, hopping and jumping on the grassy path. Spike strolls past Spike toward Sarah, laughing cheerfully, while Tom keeps glancing up happily. The four Giants stand on the path, taking deep breaths. The outline of a White Bird perches against the horizon. Spike giggles at his buddy, realizing Sarah is having great fun. The Giants reveal themselves. Suddenly, a Grifon floats into the meadow away from them. Sarah, Tom, Jerry, and Spike skip away from the narrow, roaring Hudson Bay and the bridge. The Giants tiptoe across the dock and climb onto the bridge. Sarah dances across the wooden dock, pursued by the Grifons. She dances onto the bridge, singing with delight. The Giants plug their noses. Tom and Spike jump up with the ropes. The bridge drifts out into the bay, while the Grifons relax. The Grifons settle their wings beside the south and swoop away through the meadow, slowly vanishing into the mist. Sounds of Aspen, a bustling village of brick and brightly painted houses, are nestled against a high rocky cliff. Sarah, Tom, Jerry, and Spike arrive at the lodge, calm-faced, tidy, and full of energy. A low fence borders the village, and a gentle arch marks the eastern arrival. A kind keeper nods kindly at them. The keeper flashes his torch onto the Giants, bathing them in a soothing blue glow. The Giants happily enter Aspen, the keeper greeting them warmly in the torchlight.

test_cases.description: A lengthy low howling descends from the breeze, resembling the call of some wicked and isolated being. Sam clutches Merry and Pippin as the Hobbits hurriedly scuttle up the hill, disguising themselves beneath a leafy rock. The sound of drums is nearby. A menacing cloaked Wizard glides into sight, shrouded and eyeless, perched on a large growling white dragon with crazed eyes. Frodo stiffens in shock. The Wizard halts right next to their hiding spot, remaining very immobile with his arms crossed, waiting. Droplets of sweat form on his neck. The Wizard suddenly hops off his dragon, extending over the leafy rock and glancing suspiciously into the fields. From under the cloak comes a sniffing sound as if he is attempting to detect an elusive fragrance, his gaze drifting from left to right. He is pulling the necklace out of his bag, with shaky fingers, his expression feverish and damp as if in the grasp of some dreadful internal debate. Merry urgently flings the apples across the path. The Wizard whirls around at the noise and rushes to the opposite side of the path with startling swiftness. Frodo immediately collapses as if a mental thread had been severed. Frodo is gazing, a look of bewilderment on his face at the necklace resting in the palm of his hand. The White Mage turns and retreats. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin dash through the meadows, stumbling and tripping on the stony ground. Merry maneuvers past Pippin toward Frodo, observing closely, while Sam keeps glancing around anxiously. The four Hobbits collapse on the earth, holding their breath. The outline of a White Mage rises against the horizon. Merry looks toward his companion, realizing Frodo is in severe peril. The Hobbits emerge from hiding. Suddenly, a Wizard erupts out of the meadow toward them. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin are sprinting toward the wide, calm Greenfield Stream and the barge. The Hobbits rush across the dock and tumble onto the barge. Frodo dashes across the stone dock, pursued by the Wizards. He jumps onto the barge, yelling with fury. The Hobbits cover their eyes. Sam and Merry push off with the oars. The barge glides out into the stream, just as the Wizards arrive. The Wizards spin their dragons toward the east and soar away along the riverbank, quickly vanishing into the mist. Lights of Osgiliath, a small town of brick and clay cottages, are nestled against a gentle wooded slope. Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin reach the watchtower, wide-eyed, disheveled, and breathless. A thick fence encloses the town, and a tall gate obstructs the southern access. A grumpy watchman peers down at them. The watchman swings his torch onto the Hobbits, enveloping them in an uneasy orange spotlight. The Hobbits thankfully enter Osgiliath, the watchman observing them inquisitively in the torchlight.

Lucy eagerly juggles the daffodils toward the pond. The Pegasus twirls around at the noise and glides to the near side of the meadow with surprising grace. Jamie immediately skips as if a musical connection had resonated. Jamie is gaping, a look of awe on her eyes at the necklace dangling from the tip of her fingers. The White Flyer pivots and drifts. Jamie, Alex, Lucy, and Jamie dance across the meadow, hopping and twirling on the grassy path. Lucy twirls alongside Jamie toward Jamie, observing quietly, while Alex keeps glancing around calmly. The four foxes sway on the path, enjoying the breeze. The outline of a White Flyer drifts against the sunset. Lucy glances at her companion, recognizing Jamie is in deep celebration. The foxes soar forth. Abruptly, a Pegasus glides through the clouds toward them. Jamie, Alex, Lucy, and Jamie are swinging toward the narrow, sparkling Emerald Brook and the raft. The foxes dash across the dock and climb aboard the raft. Jamie twirls across the wooden dock, escorted by the Pegasi. She bounds onto the raft, laughing with joy. The foxes cover their cheeks. Alex and Lucy push off with the oars. The raft drifts out into the brook, as the Pegasi arrive. The Pegasi swivel their cats toward the south and trot along the brookside, elegantly fading into the mist. Lanterns of Dale, a tiny hamlet of brick and plastered homes, are clustered along a rolling grassy hill. Jamie, Alex, Lucy, and Jamie reach the gatehouse, wide-eyed, tidy, and catching their breath. A tall fence surrounds the hamlet, and a small door opens the eastern entrance. A happy doorman peers up at them. The doorman raises his flashlight onto the foxes, enveloping them in a warm orange glow. The foxes merrily exit Dale, the doorman observing them warmly in the flashlight glow.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A chilling wail haunts the wind as Sam, Merry, and Pippin quickly hide under a mossy log. A menacing Ringwraith, hooded and faceless on a fierce black horse, approaches. Frodo, paralyzed with fear, grips the ring, trembling. The Ringwraith dismounts, sniffing for the ring's scent. Merry hurls mushrooms to distract him, prompting Frodo to break a psychic link. As the Black Rider departs, the Hobbits scramble through the trees, slipping on mud, with Merry realizing Frodo is in grave danger. Suddenly, pursued by Ringwraiths, they race to the Brandywine River, tumbling onto a ferry just in time to escape. The Ringwraiths gallop away as fog engulfs them. The Hobbits reach Bree, a village guarded by a thick hedge and a great gate. Exhausted, they enter, under the watchful eye of a curious gatekeeper.
